pageContext.claim: “I mean, two countries have said, “We cannot believe, to be honest with you, we’ve gotten away with [military and trade imbalances for] so long.”  Now, one of them made that statement before I got elected.  He said, “I can’t believe I made that statement before I got elected.”  But it’s one of those things.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump has a habit of relying conversations with world leaders that may or may not be true. In September 2017, he made a similarly exaggerated claim about what world leaders had told him about the GDP. And he has admitted to making up trade claims while meeting with Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau.
